overview:
Amir Khoshnevis is a recognized national leader in optometry, Amir’s goal is to actively improve the healthcare system so that all patients can receive the highest quality and most informed level of care possible.

After graduating from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with a BS degree in biology, Amir went onto receive a doctorate from the Pennsylvania College of Optometry. Soon after, he spent four years as an associate of the Eye Care Clinic before founding Carolina Family Eye Care in 2003. Over the years, Amir’s professional achievements and dedication to his craft have been internationally recognized. In 2011, Vision Monday and the Review of Optometry Business listed him as one of the top 35 innovative doctors in the field of Optometry. More recently, he was honored with the title of Philanthropist of the Year by the world-renowned charity, Optometry Giving Sight. Amir is an integral member of the WeRx.org team, and is honored to be working alongside his family on such a significant initiative.
